intro: Katoella, commonly known as the red lily or Katoella lily, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It belongs to the genus Katoella within the family Liliaceae, which includes lilies and related plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red or pink flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Katoella is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
